text.p: A Reuter survey of analysts covering Finnish equities showed a 200 million markka median forecast for forest industry group Metsa-Serla Oy's full-year 1996 profit before extraordinary items and tax:
(Profit forecasts by 15 analysts, EPS by 10 analysts).
Metsa-Serla's results are due on Feb 10.
In 1995, Metsa-Serla posted a 1.91 billion markka profit after financial items.

Eleven of the 15 analysts polled gave forecasts for Metsa-Serla's dividend for 1996 with the median at 1.00 markka (mean 1.00 markka) in a 0.30-1.40 markka range. The dividend for 1995 was 7.00 markka.
For the company's full-year 1997 profit, 10 of the 15 analysts polled gave a median forecast of 580 million markka (mean 622 million) in a 64-960 million markka range.

Contributors to the survey were Alfred Berg, AG Private Bankers, Aktia Bank, Aros Securities, Carnegie, Erik Selin, Evli Securities, FSB Securites, Handelsbanken, Interbank, Kleinwort Benson, Merita Bank, Opstock, Paribas and S-E Banken.
